member.name: T:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Print3DManager
member.summary: Creates the 3D printing experience.

member.summary: Occurs when a new 3D print job has been created.

member.summary: Gets a 3D print manager.
member.returns: The 3D print manager.

member.summary: Programmatically initiates the 3D printing user interface.

member.summary: Represents a 3D print job.

member.summary: Gets the 3D print package to be printed.
member.returns: The 3D print package to be printed.

member.summary: Occurs when the print request has been sent to the 3D printer and the 3D print job has been created.

member.summary: Occurs when the workflow modifies the 3D print package.

member.summary: Occurs when the 3D print package has been submitted to the 3D printer.

member.summary: Provides data for the Completed event of the 3D print request.

member.summary: Gets the status of the 3D print request.
member.returns: The completion status of the 3D print request.

member.name: P:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Print3DTaskCompletedEventArgs.ExtendedStatus
member.summary: Gets the type of error encountered during the 3D print request.
member.returns: The type of error encountered during the 3D print request.

member.name: T:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Print3DTaskCompletion
member.summary: Specifies the completion status of a 3D print request.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Print3DTaskCompletion.Abandoned
member.summary: The request has been abandoned.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Print3DTaskCompletion.Canceled
member.summary: The request has been cancelled.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Print3DTaskCompletion.Failed
member.summary: The request has failed.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Print3DTaskCompletion.Slicing
member.summary: The driver is preparing layer by layer slices of the 3D model for the printer.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Print3DTaskCompletion.Submitted
member.summary: The request has been submitted successfully.

member.name: T:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Print3DTaskDetail
member.summary: Specifies the type of errors encountered during a 3D print request.

member.summary: An invalid printing material has been selected.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Print3DTaskDetail.InvalidModel
member.summary: The 3D model is not valid.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Print3DTaskDetail.InvalidPrintTicket
member.summary: The print ticket is not valid.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Print3DTaskDetail.ModelExceedsPrintBed
member.summary: The 3D model exceeds the print bed.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Print3DTaskDetail.ModelNotManifold
member.summary: The 3d model does not have manifold edges.

member.summary: No additional information is available.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Print3DTaskDetail.UploadFailed
member.summary: The upload of the 3D print package failed.

member.summary: Creates a 3D print job.

member.summary: Provides data for the Print3DTaskSourceRequestedHandler delegate.

member.name: T:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3D3MFPackage
member.summary: Represents a 3D Manufacturing Format (3MF) package.

member.name: M:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3D3MFPackage.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a Printing3D3MFPackage object.

member.name: P:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3D3MFPackage.Compression
member.summary: Gets and sets the intended file compression level for this 3MF package. This is taken into account when the Printing3D3MFPackage instance is converted to a 3MF file.
member.returns: A Printing3DPackageCompression value describing the level of compression intended.

member.name: P:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3D3MFPackage.ModelPart
member.summary: Gets or sets an XML stream to the 3D model in the 3D Manufacturing Format (3MF) package.
member.returns: An XML stream to the 3D model in the 3MF package.

member.name: P:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3D3MFPackage.PrintTicket
member.summary: Gets or sets a stream to the print ticket in the 3D Manufacturing Format (3MF) package.
member.returns: A stream to the print ticket in the 3MF package.

member.name: P:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3D3MFPackage.Textures
member.summary: Gets or sets the textures in the 3D Manufacturing Format (3MF) package.
member.returns: The textures in the 3MF package, of type Printing3DTextureResource.

member.name: P:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3D3MFPackage.Thumbnail
member.summary: Gets or sets a thumbnail image that represents the contents of the 3D Manufacturing Format (3MF) package.
member.returns: A thumbnail image that represents the contents of the 3MF package.

member.name: M:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3D3MFPackage.LoadAsync(Windows.Storage.Streams.IRandomAccessStream)
member.summary: Creates a Printing3D3MFPackage object from a 3D Manufacturing Format (3MF) file stream.
member.param: A 3MF file stream.
member.returns: A Printing3D3MFPackage created from the specified 3MF package stream.

member.name: M:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3D3MFPackage.LoadModelFromPackageAsync(Windows.Storage.Streams.IRandomAccessStream)
member.summary: Creates a Printing3DModel object from a 3D Manufacturing Format (3MF) file stream.
member.param: A 3MF file stream.
member.returns: A Printing3DModel object created from the specified 3MF object stream.

member.name: M:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3D3MFPackage.SaveAsync
member.summary: Saves the Printing3D3MFPackage object to a 3D Manufacturing Format (3MF) file stream.
member.returns: A stream to the 3MF file where the package is to be saved.

member.name: M:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3D3MFPackage.SaveModelToPackageAsync(Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DModel)
member.summary: Saves the specified 3D model to the 3D Manufacturing Format (3MF) package.
member.param: The 3D model to be saved to the 3MF package.
member.returns: The results of the operation.

member.summary: Specifies how to parse data in the buffer.

member.summary: Specifies the format used by the buffer.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DBufferDescription.Stride
member.summary: Specifies how far to move the pointer forward to find the next unit of data.

member.name: T:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DBufferFormat
member.summary: Specifies the format used by the buffer.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DBufferFormat.Printing3DDouble
member.summary: A buffer of type **double**.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DBufferFormat.Printing3DUInt
member.summary: A buffer of type **uint**.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DBufferFormat.R32G32B32A32Float
member.summary: A four-component, 128-bit floating-point format that supports 32 bits per channel including alpha.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DBufferFormat.R32G32B32A32UInt
member.summary: A four-component, 128-bit unsigned-integer format that supports 32 bits per channel including alpha.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DBufferFormat.R32G32B32Float
member.summary: A three-component, 96-bit floating-point format that supports 32 bits per color channel.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DBufferFormat.R32G32B32UInt
member.summary: A three-component, 96-bit unsigned-integer format that supports 32 bits per color channel.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DBufferFormat.Unknown
member.summary: The format is not known.

member.summary: Creates an instance of the Printing3DComponentWithMatrix class.

member.summary: Gets or sets the 3D Manufacturing Format (3MF) primitive component that's applied to the object definition with a matrix transform.

member.summary: Gets or sets the matrix transform that's applied to the 3D Manufacturing Format (3MF) primitive component.
member.returns: The matrix transform that's applied to the 3D Manufacturing Format (3MF) primitive component.

member.name: T:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DCompositeMaterial
member.summary: Represents a composite material that's defined by a mixture of base materials.

member.name: M:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DCompositeMaterial.#ctor
member.summary: Creates an instance of the Printing3DCompositeMaterial class.

member.name: P:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DCompositeMaterial.Values
member.summary: Gets the mixture of base materials used in the composite material. Each mixture is defined by listing the proportion of the overall mixture for each base material (values between 0 and 1).
member.returns: The proportions of base materials used in the composite material (values between 0 and 1). Proportion values are specified in the same order as the base materials in MaterialIndices.

member.name: T:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DCompositeMaterialGroup
member.summary: Represents a group of composite materials.

member.name: M:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DCompositeMaterialGroup.#ctor(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Creates an instance of the Printing3DCompositeMaterialGroup class.
member.param: The identifier (ID) of the composite material group; a value greater than zero.

member.name: P:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DCompositeMaterialGroup.BaseMaterialGroup
member.summary: Gets the existing Printing3DBaseMaterialGroup whose Printing3DBaseMaterial members will be used to produce composite materials.
member.returns: The Printing3DBaseMaterialGroup from which to produce composite materials.

member.name: P:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DCompositeMaterialGroup.Composites
member.summary: Gets an list of mixtures that define individual composite materials. Each mixture is defined by listing the proportion of the overall mixture for each base material (values between 0 and 1), where the proportion values are specified in the same order as the base materials in MaterialIndices.
member.returns: A list of mixtures that define individual composite materials.

member.name: P:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DCompositeMaterialGroup.MaterialGroupId
member.summary: Gets the identifier (ID) of the base material group that defines the materials used in the composite material group.
member.returns: The ID of the base material group that defines the materials used in the composite material group.

member.name: P:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DCompositeMaterialGroup.MaterialIndices
member.summary: Gets an ordered list of base materials that are used to make the composite materials in the group. The order of base materials is maintained in the mixture values defined by Composites.
member.returns: Index values of base materials from the base material group specified by MaterialGroupId.

member.name: T:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DFaceReductionOptions
member.summary: Provides additional information for the TryReduceFacesAsync method in the Printing3DModel class

member.name: M:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DFaceReductionOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Creates an instance of the Printing3DFaceReductionOptions class.

member.name: P:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DFaceReductionOptions.MaxEdgeLength
member.summary: Sets the maximum length of an edge for which the triangles that share said edge can be merged via the TryReduceFacesAsync method. If set to zero, a built-in default value is used.
member.returns: Maximum length of an edge for which the triangles that share said edge can be merged.

member.name: P:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DFaceReductionOptions.MaxReductionArea
member.summary: Sets the area of a triangle above which said triangle cannot be merged via the TryReduceFacesAsync method. If set to zero, a built-in default value is used.
member.returns: Maximum area at which a triangle can be merged.

member.name: P:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DFaceReductionOptions.TargetTriangleCount
member.summary: Sets the desired number of triangles on a mesh. The TryReduceFacesAsync method will stop merging faces if the triangle count is less than or equal to this number. If set to zero, the algorithm will run until the number of triangles is reduced by half.
member.returns: Desired number of triangles on a mesh.

member.name: M:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DMesh.VerifyAsync(Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DMeshVerificationMode)
member.summary: Verifies the mesh has manifold edges and normal triangles.
member.param: Specifies how the mesh is verified.
member.returns: The results of the verification, of type Printing3DMeshVerificationResult.

member.summary: Specifies the mode in which the mesh is verified.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DMeshVerificationMode.FindAllErrors
member.summary: Wait to return results until the verification is complete.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DMeshVerificationMode.FindFirstError
member.summary: Return results upon finding the first failure.

member.name: T:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DMeshVerificationResult
member.summary: Provides data for the VerifyAsync method.

member.name: P:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DMeshVerificationResult.IsValid
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates if the mesh is valid.
member.returns: **true** if the mesh is valid; otherwise, **false**.

member.name: P:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DMeshVerificationResult.NonmanifoldTriangles
member.summary: Gets the triangles with non-manifold edges, if applicable.
member.returns: The triangles with non-manifold edges.

member.name: P:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DMeshVerificationResult.ReversedNormalTriangles
member.summary: Gets the reverse normal triangles, if applicable.

member.name: T:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DModel
member.summary: Represents the 3D model in a 3D Manufacturing Format (3MF) package.

member.summary: Creates an instance of the Printing3DModel class.

member.name: P:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DModel.Build
member.summary: Gets or sets the root 3D Manufacturing Format (3MF) component. It represents the build plate on a 3D printer and defines what will be printed.

member.summary: Gets all 3D Manufacturing Format (3MF) components used in the 3D model.

member.summary: Gets or sets the root material container for the 3D model.
member.returns: The root material container for the 3D model.

member.name: P:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DModel.Meshes
member.summary: Gets all meshes used in the 3D model.
member.returns: All meshes used in the 3D model, of type Printing3DMesh.

member.name: P:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DModel.Metadata
member.summary: Gets the metadata for the 3D Manufacturing Format (3MF) package.
member.returns: The metadata for the 3MF package.

member.name: P:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DModel.RequiredExtensions
member.summary: Gets a list of the extensions required by the 3D Manufacturing Format (3MF) package.
member.returns: The extensions required by the 3MF package.

member.name: P:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DModel.Textures
member.summary: Gets all textures used in the 3D model.
member.returns: All textures used in the 3D model, of type Printing3DModelTexture.

member.name: P:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DModel.Unit
member.summary: Gets or sets the units of measure used in the 3D model.
member.returns: The units of measure used in the 3D model.

member.name: P:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DModel.Version
member.summary: Gets or sets the version of the 3D Manufacturing Format (3MF) package.
member.returns: The version of the 3MF package.

member.name: M:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DModel.Clone
member.summary: Gets a copy of the current 3D model.
member.returns: A copy of the current 3D model.

member.name: M:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DModel.RepairAsync
member.summary: Executes the 3D model repair algorithm on the model.
member.returns: Results of the operation.

member.name: M:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DModel.RepairWithProgressAsync
member.summary: Executes the 3D model repair algorithm, with the ability to report the progress of the operation.
member.returns: A **Boolean** value indicating whether the asynchronous operation succeeded, and a **Double** value reporting the progress as a decimal number between zero and one.

member.name: M:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DModel.TryPartialRepairAsync
member.summary: Executes the 3D model repair algorithm until complete or an exception is thrown.
member.returns: **true** if the asynchronous operation succeeded; otherwise, **false**.

member.name: M:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DModel.TryPartialRepairAsync(Windows.Foundation.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Begins the 3D model repair algorithm, but exits if the time limit is reached.
member.param: Defines the amount of time (in seconds) that the algorithm can run for. A value of 0 will cause the algorithm to run until another end condition is met.
member.returns: **true** if the asynchronous operation succeeded; otherwise, **false**.

member.name: M:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DModel.TryReduceFacesAsync
member.summary: Runs an algorithm that reduces the number of triangle faces in all of the meshes within the Printing3DModel by merging nearby vertices. Stops when the total number of triangles is reduced by half.
member.returns: A **Boolean** value indicating whether the asynchronous operation succeeded, and a **Double** value reporting the progress as a decimal number between zero and one.

member.name: M:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DModel.TryReduceFacesAsync(Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DFaceReductionOptions)
member.summary: Runs an algorithm that reduces the number of triangle faces in all of the meshes within the Printing3DModel by merging nearby vertices. Stops according to the specified options.
member.param: Defines the conditions which will trigger the end of the operation.
member.returns: A **Boolean** value indicating whether the asynchronous operation succeeded, and a **Double** value reporting the progress as a decimal number between zero and one.

member.name: M:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DModel.TryReduceFacesAsync(Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DFaceReductionOptions,Windows.Foundation.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Runs an algorithm that reduces the number of triangle faces in all of the meshes within the Printing3DModel by merging nearby vertices. Stops according to the specified options or when the *maxWait* time is reached.
member.param: Defines the conditions which will trigger the end of the operation.
Defines the amount of time (in seconds) that the algorithm can run for. A value of 0 will cause the algorithm to run until another end condition is met.
member.returns: A **Boolean** value indicating whether the asynchronous operation succeeded, and a **Double** value reporting the progress as a decimal number between zero and one.

member.summary: The units of the 3D model are specified in meters.

member.summary: The units of the 3D model are specified in microns.

member.name: T:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DMultiplePropertyMaterial
member.summary: Represents a combination of properties and/or materials from the material groups specified in (MaterialGroupIndices ).

member.name: M:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DMultiplePropertyMaterial.#ctor
member.summary: Creates an instance of the Printing3DMultiplePropertyMaterial class.

member.name: P:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DMultiplePropertyMaterial.MaterialIndices
member.summary: Gets the indices of the properties and/or materials combined in the multi-property material. Each combination is defined by listing the index of an item from one material group with the index of an item from a secondary material group. The index values are specified in the same order as the material groups listed in MaterialGroupIndices.
member.returns: The indices of the properties or materials combined in the multi-property.

member.name: T:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DMultiplePropertyMaterialGroup
member.summary: Represents a multi-property material group.

member.name: M:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DMultiplePropertyMaterialGroup.#ctor(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the Printing3DMultiplePropertyMaterialGroup class.
member.param: The identifier (ID) of the multi-property material group; a value greater than zero.

member.name: P:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DMultiplePropertyMaterialGroup.MaterialGroupId
member.summary: Gets the identifier (ID) of the multi-property material group.
member.returns: The ID of the multi-property material group.

member.name: P:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DMultiplePropertyMaterialGroup.MaterialGroupIndices
member.summary: Gets an ordered list of material groups (**MaterialGroupId** values) that are used to define property-material combinations in the multi-property group. The order of material groups is maintained in the combinations defined by MultipleProperties.
member.returns: The indices of the properties or materials in the group.

member.name: P:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DMultiplePropertyMaterialGroup.MultipleProperties
member.summary: Gets a list of property-material combinations. Each combination is defined by listing the index of an item from one material group with the index of an item from a secondary material group. The index values are specified in the same order as the material groups listed in MaterialGroupIndices.
member.returns: A list of property-material combinations .

member.name: T:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DObjectType
member.summary: Specifies the function of the object in the 3D model.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DObjectType.Model
member.summary: Functions as a core component of the 3D model.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DObjectType.Others
member.summary: Functions in some other capacity.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DObjectType.Support
member.summary: Functions as a support object.

member.name: T:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DPackageCompression
member.summary: Contains values that describe the intended file compression level.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DPackageCompression.High
member.summary: High file compression. This is recommended to reduce the size of the 3MF package before saving it to disk or sending it over the network.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DPackageCompression.Low
member.summary: Low file compression. This results in faster in-memory processing.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DPackageCompression.Medium
member.summary: Medium file compression. This is the default value.

member.name: T:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DTexture2CoordMaterial
member.summary: Represents a 2D texture material used in the 3D model.

member.name: M:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DTexture2CoordMaterial.#ctor
member.summary: Creates an instance of the Printing3DTexture2CoordMaterial class.

member.name: P:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DTexture2CoordMaterial.Texture
member.summary: Gets or sets the texture used in the 2D texture material.
member.returns: The texture used in the 2D texture material.

member.name: P:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DTexture2CoordMaterial.U
member.summary: Gets or sets the U-coordinate within the texture, horizontally right from the origin in the upper left of the texture.
member.returns: The U-coordinate within the texture.

member.name: P:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DTexture2CoordMaterial.V
member.summary: Gets or sets the V-coordinate within the texture, vertically down from the origin in the upper left of the texture.
member.returns: The V-coordinate within the texture.

member.name: T:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DTexture2CoordMaterialGroup
member.summary: Represents a group of 2D texture materials used in the 3D model.

member.name: M:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DTexture2CoordMaterialGroup.#ctor(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Creates a instance of the Printing3DTexture2CoordMaterialGroup class.
member.param: The identifier for a group of 2D texture materials used in the 3D model; a value greater than zero.

member.name: P:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DTexture2CoordMaterialGroup.MaterialGroupId
member.summary: Gets the identifier (ID) of the 2D texture material group.
member.returns: The ID of the 2D texture material group.

member.name: P:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DTexture2CoordMaterialGroup.Texture
member.summary: Gets or sets the texture of the material group.
member.returns: The texture of the material group.

member.name: P:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DTexture2CoordMaterialGroup.Texture2Coords
member.summary: Gets a group of 2D texture materials used in the 3D model.
member.returns: A group of 2D texture materials used in the 3D model, of type Printing3DTexture2CoordMaterial.

member.name: T:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DTextureEdgeBehavior
member.summary: Specifies how tiling should occur in the U and V axis in order to fill the overall requested area of a texture.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DTextureEdgeBehavior.Clamp
member.summary: Clamps texture coordinates to the [0.0, 1.0] range. That is, it applies the texture once, then smears the color of edge pixels. For example, suppose that your application creates a square primitive and assigns texture coordinates of (0.0,0.0), (0.0,3.0), (3.0,3.0), and (3.0,0.0) to the primitive's vertices. Setting the **Clamp** texture edge behavior results in the texture being applied once.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DTextureEdgeBehavior.Mirror
member.summary: Tiles mirror the texture at every integer boundary. For example, with texture coordinates of (0.0,0.0), (0.0,3.0), (3.0,3.0), and (3.0,0.0). Setting the **Wrap** texture edge behavior results in the texture being applied three times in both the u- and v-directions. Every other row and column that it is applied is a mirror image of the preceding row or column, as shown here.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DTextureEdgeBehavior.None
member.summary: No tiling will occur.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DTextureEdgeBehavior.Wrap
member.summary: Tiles repeat the texture resource at every integer junction. For example, with texture coordinates of (0.0,0.0), (0.0,3.0), (3.0,3.0), and (3.0,0.0), setting the **Wrap** texture edge behavior results in the texture being applied three times in both the u-and v-directions, as shown here.

member.name: T:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DTextureResource
member.summary: Specifies the texture resource used in a 2D texture material.

member.name: M:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DTextureResource.#ctor
member.summary: Creates an instance of the Printing3DTextureResource class.

member.name: P:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DTextureResource.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the texture resource.
member.returns: The name of the texture resource.

member.name: P:Windows.Graphics.Printing3D.Printing3DTextureResource.TextureData
member.summary: Gets or sets the image stream of the texture resource.
member.returns: The image stream of the texture resource.
